data.text:
What Happened in 2022?

As we journeyed through the year, 2022 unfurled a cinematic tapestry that was as diverse as it was fascinating. From the terrifying shrieks echoing from Scream, to the comic book noir of The Batman and the laugh-out-loud hilarity of Turning Red, it was a year of rich narratives that spoke to us in myriad ways. Underneath the thrilling action, profound drama, and laugh-out-loud comedy, we discovered layers of humanity that left indelible marks on our hearts.

A Look at the Movies That Shaped 2022

Each film presented us with a unique journey. Let's dive deeper into these cinematic milestones that made 2022 an unforgettable year in film.

No Bears

Directed by the illustrious Jafar Panahi, No Bears uses its simple premise to dig deep into the layers of the human condition. Through a narrative structured around two parallel love stories, the film masterfully explores the challenges of love in the face of adversity. It's a testament to Panahi's incisive filmmaking and his talent for urging audiences to examine the complexities of seemingly simple narratives.

Happening

Moving on, we encounter the haunting Happening. Set in 1963 France, it follows the life of a young student grappling with an unexpected pregnancy. The narrative is as heartrending as it is rewarding, effectively bringing to life the personal implications of a tough choice and its aftermath. Audrey Diwan's direction leads us on a deeply human journey, one that leaves us contemplating long after the credits roll.

Marcel the Shell with Shoes On

As we traverse the emotional spectrum, Marcel the Shell with Shoes On offers a heartwarming diversion from more somber tales. This animated story brings to life the enchanting tale of Marcel, a one-inch-tall shell, in a manner that's as profoundly touching as it is entertaining.

Top Gun: Maverick

No review of 2022 cinema would be complete without mentioning Top Gun: Maverick. The blockbuster managed to set records across the board, delivering both an adrenaline-fueled spectacle and a poignant exploration of the human spirit.

Jujutsu Kaisen 0: The Movie

Anime found a hit in 2022 with Jujutsu Kaisen 0: The Movie, delivering an impressive narrative that delighted both anime enthusiasts and critics alike.

Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio

Meanwhile, Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio painted a visually stunning adaptation of a timeless tale. It showcased the power of del Toro's imaginative storytelling, solidifying its place in the cinematic narrative of 2022.

Girl Picture

Girl Picture was an impressive addition to the cinematic landscape in 2022. This beautifully acted film touches on the whirlwind of teenage emotions without sacrificing narrative maturity or depth. The engaging conversations and real-world frustrations brought to life by Mimmi and Rönkkö are a testament to the film's sensitive portrayal of adolescence.

The Quiet Girl

In 2022, The Quiet Girl also stood out as a touching and emotionally resonant film. Colm Bairéad's directorial debut delves into the tale of a nine-year-old Cait, dispatched to live with foster parents due to her dysfunctional family. It offers a simple yet profound reminder of how small stories can have a significant emotional impact.

The Duke

The gripping story of Kempton Bunton in The Duke added a dash of true-crime intrigue to the year's offerings. This well-acted and engaging dramatization introduced us to a taxi driver who stole Goya's portrait of the Duke of Wellington from the National Gallery.

To Leslie

Finally, we met To Leslie, a story about a struggling single mother who wins the lottery and consequently deals with the cycle of addiction. This film's approach to the cycle of addiction provides depth to a familiar framework, thanks largely to Andrea Riseborough's powerful performance.

2022 Movies & Film Industry Highlights

Picture this, a journey through time and space. We're traversing the cinematic landscape of 2022, examining not just the spectacle, but also the significant events that shaped this vibrant year in the world of film.

The High-Grossers of 2022

In a year teeming with cinematic novelties, five films undeniably captivated global audiences. Avatar: The Way of Water was the undisputed champion of the box office, amassing an impressive gross of $2.3 billion. Following closely was Top Gun: Maverick with an equally admirable gross of $1.5 billion. Jurassic World Dominion, Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, and Minions: The Rise of Gru followed suit, with each film proving a magnet for audiences worldwide. Not to be outdone, Black Panther: Wakanda Forever, The Batman, Thor: Love and Thunder, The Battle at Lake Changjin II, and Puss in Boots: The Last Wish also fared incredibly well, all boasting significant grosses and securing spots in the top ten.

Milestones in Film Franchises

2022 witnessed numerous significant milestones across diverse franchises. The Jurassic Park franchise, with Jurassic World Dominion, soared past the $6 billion mark in total gross. Similarly, the releases of Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, Thor: Love and Thunder, and Black Panther: Wakanda Forever successively pushed the Marvel Cinematic Universe to surpass the $26 billion, $27 billion, and $28 billion marks, respectively. The Despicable Me and Shrek franchises also made notable strides, both crossing the significant threshold of $4 billion in total gross. These numbers stand as testament to the sustained appeal and undying popularity of these cinematic worlds.

The Major Players in the Industry

In the realm of film distributors, Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures emerged as the leader in 2022, commanding worldwide box office grosses with a cumulative total exceeding $4.9 billion. Top Gun: Maverick, on the other hand, stood as a beacon for Paramount Pictures, becoming the highest-grossing film distributed solely by the company, both globally and within the United States and Canada.

2022's Film Industry Records

Several movies achieved notable records in 2022. Avatar: The Way of Water set the tone for the year by becoming the highest-grossing film of both 2022 and the COVID-19 pandemic era. It also had the 11th-biggest global opening of all time and the third-biggest global opening in the pandemic era. Similarly, Top Gun: Maverick became Tom Cruise's highest-grossing film of all time and had the highest Memorial Day opening weekend. Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness brought great success to director Sam Raimi, becoming his highest-grossing film, while Black Panther: Wakanda Forever achieved the biggest opening weekend ever for a film released in November in the US and Canada. Moreover, Sonic the Hedgehog 2 set various records for its opening weekend, including the best U.S. opening for a video game film adaptation and a live-action animated film. Celebrating Cinema at Film Festivals Finally, film festivals continued to be a central pillar in the celebration and promotion of films in 2022. From the renowned Sundance Film Festival in Park City, Utah, to the International Film Festival Rotterdam in the Netherlands, these gatherings marked significant milestones in the cinematic year.
